page.title: 06Life styles in Bradfield
page.content: At one house a retired farmworker was cutting the grass outside his cottage with a scythe. Scythes are still made in Sheffield at the Abbeydale Industrial Hamlet Museum. This gentleman kept two cows, a goat, some doves and some hens. He said he felt lost without animals after working on a farm all his life. He said he could remember when turnips were grown in the fields near his house.This area is now a coniferous plantation.He said the walls of his house were nearly 1 metre thick and it was warm in winter and cool in summer.
